meanings.definition: A group of people working together for a common purpose.
meanings.sent1: The band of volunteers cleaned up the park together.
meanings.sent2: The school band performed at the football game.
meanings.sent3: The band of friends organized a surprise party for Sarah.
meanings.sent4: Their band of workers tackled the project with great enthusiasm.
meanings.sent5: The band of helpers made the event run smoothly.

meanings.definition: A strip of material used for binding or fastening.
meanings.sent1: She used a rubber band to tie her hair back.
meanings.sent2: The band of fabric held the papers together.
meanings.sent3: He found a colorful band to wrap around the gift.
meanings.sent4: The elastic band snapped when stretched too far.
meanings.sent5: The band of tape secured the box shut.

meanings.definition: A range of frequencies within a given band of wavelengths.
meanings.sent1: The radio station broadcasts on the FM band.
meanings.sent2: The Wi-Fi router operates on the 2.4 GHz band.
meanings.sent3: The scientist studied the electromagnetic band for research.
meanings.sent4: The radar detected a signal in the microwave band.
meanings.sent5: The satellite communication uses the Ku band for transmission.

meanings.definition: A flat, thin strip of material used as a decoration or to encircle something.
meanings.sent1: She wore a beautiful band of silver around her wrist.
meanings.sent2: The band of lace added elegance to the dress.
meanings.sent3: The band of ribbon adorned the gift box.
meanings.sent4: The golden band shone brightly in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The band of pearls enhanced her necklace.

meanings.definition: A group of musicians playing together.
meanings.sent1: The band performed a concert in the park.
meanings.sent2: The jazz band played at the local club.
meanings.sent3: The band of musicians practiced for hours before the show.
meanings.sent4: The rock band's music echoed through the stadium.
meanings.sent5: The band of singers harmonized beautifully on stage.
